result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar L Hopgood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Omar L Hopgood is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Omar L Hopgood was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Pay a FINE of $200.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES or, in the alternative, serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served for a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 06-14-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court ordered the weapon forfeited.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omar L Hopgood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Omar L Hopgood in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

LATER SAME DAY.  SAME APPEARANCES.
CASE RECALLED.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $200.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES or, in the alternative, serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served for a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 06-14-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court ordered the weapon forfeited.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Omar L Hopgood in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Filed, Defendant's Witness and Exhibit List and Motion and Limine.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on December 14, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Omar L Hopgood in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omar L Hopgood in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar L Hopgood in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel needs time to review discovery with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omar L Hopgood in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Omar L Hopgood in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  
Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
